contentList.content:
...erstellt vom bösen Lich Icarium dem Schwarzen, war der Zauber einer der ersten, den er während seiner vielen Studien tief in den Grenzen von Cormallen perfektionierte. Er erfuhr, dass er durch die Ausübung seines unheiligen Willens in der Lage war, die Seelen seiner Feinde in einen wirbelnden Wirbel schreiender Geister zu binden.

– Auszug aus dem Libor Mortis

...Das Buch der Toten. In Menschenhaut gefesselt und mit dem Blut von Mördern getränkt. Dieses unheilige Buch enthält bizarre Bestattungsriten, Bestattungsformeln und Passagen zur Auferstehung von Dämonen. Es war nie für die Augen der Lebenden gedacht. Es war nie für dich bestimmt. Sie erinnern sich an alte Legenden, die erzählen, dass in den Seiten dieses blasphemischen Buches die Geheimnisse des ewigen Lebens über den Tod hinaus liegen. Wörter schlängeln sich scheinbar über die Seiten des Buches und werden unleserlich, je mehr man versucht, den Text zu übersetzen. Die Kritzeleien bilden gelegentlich zusammenhängende Wörter und laden Sie ein, ihre Geheimnisse herauszufinden ... ...Schreckensherrscher... ...aeternusvitae...
...Orden des Dracolich... ...Seelenernte ...
..der Größere Untote...

...die ganze Luft zuckt vor Angst vor seiner böswilligen Anwesenheit. Seine zerstörte Gestalt wird von zwei riesigen Flügeln flankiert, die sich wie ein großer Schatten hinter ihm ausbreiten, und einem Schwanz, an dessen Spitze böse dunkle Flammen sprühen. Seine Augen – zwei Nadelstiche aus rotem Licht, die in unheiliger Energie aus dem Inneren eines drakonischen Schädels flammten – blickten auf uns herab. Die Kultisten schreckten vor dem Dracolich zurück, als der faulige Gestank von Tod und Verfall, der ihn wie ein bösartiges Leichentuch umgab, uns überkam. Für das Versprechen von Wissen und Macht haben wir uns bereitwillig seinem Schrecken und seiner Verzweiflung ergeben.

– Auszug aus dem Libor Mortis
Vorsicht! Nicht einmal Verbündete sind vor deiner schrecklichen Macht sicher!
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Erfordert einen aktiven <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Soulshield">Schild der Seelen</LSTag>.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Der Schleier hat keine Wirkung auf Untote und Konstrukte.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Das Ziel muss eine große oder mittelgroße Leiche sein.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Schaltet visuelle Effekte außerhalb des Kampfes aus.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Das Tragen von leichter, mittlerer oder schwerer Rüstung in einem beliebigen Slot schränkt die Fähigkeit ein, gefangene Seelen zurückzuhalten.

<LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_NecroticBlade">Necrotic Armaments</LSTag> erlaubt es dir, Shillelagh auf deine Waffe zu wirken, ohne eine <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonusaktion</LSTag> zu verbrauchen.
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TAUNTED">Stacheln Sie</LSTag> Feinde dazu an, Sie anzugreifen.
Ein dunkles Ritual hat diesen Nekromanten in einen wandelnden Seelenmagneten verwandelt, der verlorene Seelen in seinem gefräßigen Seelenschild gefangen hält.
Ein furchterregender Aspekt des Schreckensfürsten, eine überragende Gestalt des Schreckens und der Verzweiflung.
In der Nähe dieser Kreatur ist eine gespenstische Erscheinung aufgetaucht, die sie vor Schaden schützt. Die betroffene Entität hat +[1] zu ihrer <LSTag Tooltip="ArmorClass">Rüstungsklasse</LSTag>.

Ein gruselig aussehender Kampfstab aus der Wirbelsäule eines Opfers, auf dem ein Schädel thront, der fast lebendig wirkt, da sich der Kiefer bedrohlich in einer beißenden Bewegung bewegt. Es sieht so aus, als könnte es jemandem böse Kopfschmerzen bereiten.

In dem vor Ihnen liegenden Buch erscheint eine Passage, die scheinbar einer Quelle außerhalb des Totenbuchs entnommen ist und die sehr trockene Geschichte eines Rechtsstreits zwischen einem Magierkonsortium und einem ihrer Lehrlinge erzählt. „...die Experimente mit nicht genehmigter Magie wurden zu einem Streitpunkt zwischen den Großmagiern und ihrem besten Schüler.“ Vor seinem Ausschluss aus dem Tower äußerte das Konsortium seine Besorgnis über die möglichen verfälschenden Auswirkungen seiner Studien und versuchte... ...die Schrift auf der Seite ändert sich plötzlich und scheint die dokumentierte Geschichte zu verspotten. Auf der Seite tanzen Worte und Bilder, die einen inneren Verrat, eine Verschwörung eines verschlagenen Nekromanten und den Fall des Turms darstellen. Dann kam es zu einem Krieg zwischen den überlebenden Hochmagiern und einer Allianz aus Nekromanten und Todesrittern, angeführt von einem Dracolich, der das bösartige Shroud de Aeternus Vitae trägt . Gesichter und Körper, ausgetrocknet von den dunklen Windungen des Dracolich, füllen die Seiten des unheiligen Buches. Schreie von einem längst vergessenen Schlachtfeld umgeben Sie und erreichen ein ohrenbetäubendes Crescendo. Du bist wie gelähmt, während dunkle Ranken aus den einzelnen Seiten des Buches herauskriechen ... ... dann verstummen Schreie aus dem Buch und die Ranken, die dich suchen, lösen sich auf. Worte tauchen auf, die die Geschichte eines dunklen Rituals erzählen, mit dem der Geist einer mächtigen Todesfee in einem lebenden Seelenkäfig gefangen gehalten werden soll. An den Rändern des Buches erscheinen feine Kritzeleien, die darauf hinweisen, dass Vorsicht geboten ist, damit der Nekromant nicht besessen wird.

Die Seele einer kürzlich getöteten Kreatur weint vor Qual, als sie in einem <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Soulshield">Seelenschild</LSTag> verschwindet.
Bietet +[1] für <LSTag Tooltip= „ArmorClass“>Rüstungsklasse</LSTag> bis <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Lange Rast</LSTag>.

Die Seele einer kürzlich getöteten Kreatur schreit vor Wut, als sie im Seelenschild verschwindet.

Der Geist überlädt den Schild und liefert Resistenz gegen physischen Schaden. Alle Geisterbeschwörungen werden verstärkt und bieten zusätzliche Effekte.

Ein wirbelnder Geisterwirbel schützt den Nekromanten vor eingehenden Angriffen.
Hat +[1] auf <LSTag Tooltip="ArmorClass">Rüstungsklasse</LSTag> bis <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Lange Rast</LSTag>. [2] Zusätzliche Seele(n) können an den Seelenschild gebunden werden.

Ein wirbelnder Geisterwirbel schützt diesen <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_ImmuneToControlUndead">Großen Untoten</LSTag> vor eingehenden Angriffen.
Hat +[1] zu <LSTag Tooltip="ArmorClass"> Rüstungsklasse</LSTag> bis <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Lange Rast</LSTag>.

Durch die Aktivierung von <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_DarkEmpathy" >Dunkle Empathie</LSTag> wird die Macht des Leichentuches auf deine Verbündeten ausgeweitet und sie erhalten [1] Heilung.
Antiker Streitkolben
Andras der Teufelshund

As a cultist trained by the <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_LORE_OrderOfTheDracolich">Order of the Dracolich</LSTag>, you are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in Flails, Maces, Scimitars, Sickles, and Shields. You may call upon the <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_LORE_DreadOverlord">Dread Overlord's</LSTag> power to ignite your weapon with his dark fire with the cantrip <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_NecroticBlade">Necrotic Armaments</LSTag> at-will.
Der Aspekt des Schreckensherrschers
Aura of Despair

Bind into a corpse the spirit of a powerful warlock under your command. This <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_ImmuneToControlUndead">Greater Undead</LSTag> has access to <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_UndeadPactMagic">Pact Magic</LSTag> from your patron, allowing it to cast powerful spells and recharge its <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> after each <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.

Bind the souls of fallen enemies to your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Soulshield">Shield of Souls</LSTag>. Each <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_HARVESTED_SOUL">Captured Soul</LSTag> adds +[1] to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmorClass">Armor Class</LSTag> until <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. You may reap the dead in the heat of battle.
Bone Staff
Brutal Leap
Call upon the Undying Emperor to aid you in battle! A fearsome aspect of the <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_LORE_DreadOverlord">Dread Overlord</LSTag> intervenes in your behalf.
Captured Soul
Captured Souls (Counter)

Command angry spirits from your soulshield to haunt your enemies. The Captured Souls form into [1] shadow wraiths for [2] turns. The wraiths can use Shadow Teleportation and Darkness Cloak.

Empowered Soulshield: Shadow wraiths have Haste.

Command angry spirits from your soulshield to haunt your enemies. The Captured Souls form into [1] shadow wraiths for [2] turns.

Empowered Soulshield: Shadow wraiths have Haste.
Commit Corpse
Consume Souls

Corrupted by the Dread Overlord's cruelty, malice and will to dominate all life, the cultists of the Order of the Dracolich carry out his terror on Toril. In return for their service, the dracolich promised dominion over life and death itself with many cultists believing that with enough power you can overcome both. Wielding armies of undead, they devote their lives and unlives to the mastery over mortality. Their battlecry 'MORS PRINCIPIUM EST!' is in defiance over the very concept of finality.

-- Excerpt from the Libor Mortis

Create a skeletal giant under your command. A massive frontline attacker, this <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_ImmuneToControlUndead">Greater Undead</LSTag> strikes with <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_GiantSlam_Passive">phenomenal power</LSTag>. Once per turn, the skeletal giant can slam its weapon into enemies in a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DreadOverlord_SkeletalGiant_Slam">Gargantuan Strike</LSTag>.
Cries of terror fill the air as souls of the dead swirl around.
Cursed to rise again as an undead under the service of the Dread Overlord.

Cuts and wounds close up on this creature's body as rivulets of vitality is stripped from nearby enemies by a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_ShroudDeAeternusVitae">vampiric shroud</LSTag>.

Dark coils emanating from a nearby Shroud de Aeternus Vitae swirls around in a soothing embrace.

This creature will receive half of [1] per turn.
Dunkle Empathie
Dunkle Empathie
Dark tendrils pour forth ominously from this creature's vampiric <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_ShroudDeAeternusVitae">Shroud de Aeternus Vitae</LSTag> in ravenous search of life.
Desecrated Corpse
Schreckenskultist
Dread Ward
Empowered Soulshield
Ensnare the souls of recently slain enemies into your ravenous soulshield. Triggers automatically at the end of each combat round as long as concentration is maintained.
Ensnared Soul
Eternal Servitude
Fear Incarnate
Feeding
Fell power corrupted this artifact and laid claim to its necromancy in its unholy name.

Fell power has laid claim to the Forbidden Knowledge in the Necromancy of Thay and corrupted it in its unholy name. The book's dark secrets are fully revealed to you.

In addition to Soul Magnet, you know the spells Curriculum of Strategy: Artistry of War and Dethrone, both of which you may cast without expending Warlock Spell Slots.

Fell power has laid claim to the Forbidden Knowledge in the Necromancy of Thay and corrupted it in its unholy name.

You learned of a dark ritual to turn yourself into a living Soul Magnet.

Fell power has laid claim to the necromancy in the armor Reaper's Embrace and corrupted it in its unholy name. Your Shield of Souls is no longer restricted while wearing Reaper's Embrace when wearing Light, Medium, or Heavy Armor in any slot including gloves, boots, and helmets.

You are also Proficient in Medium and Heavy Armor while wearing Reaper's Embrace.
Find Familiar: Devil Dog
Flaming Apparition
Forbidden Lore
Forbidden Lore: Libor Mortis
Forbidden Lore: Order of the Dracolich
Forbidden Lore: Shroud of Eternal Life
Forbidden Lore: Soul Harvest
Forbidden Lore: The Greater Undead
Forbidden Lore: The Undying Emperor

Gain +[1] to your Armor Class (+[2] with Improved Soul Harvest and +[3] with Greater Soul Harvest) until Long Rest. Bind additional souls to your soulshield with Commit Corpse, which adds +[4] to your Armor Class per additional soul.

Harvesting souls beyond the current capacity of your soulshield overcharges it granting increased Resistances to all physical damage for a short time. It will also result in an Empowered Soulshield granting additional effects to your spirit invocations.

Gain the power of life and death by imbuing yourself with the abilities of the undead - of vampires, wraiths, and banshees - through an unholy Shroud of Eternal Life.

An excerpt regarding this necromantic power reveals itself in the Libor Mortis.
Gargantuan Strike
Ghostly Apparition
Ghostly Apparition
Ghostly Apparitions
Ghostly apparitions surround this entity providing protection. Affected entity has +[1] to their <LSTag Tooltip="ArmorClass">Armor Class</LSTag>.
Glaring Threat
Greater Shield of Souls
Greater Shield of Souls
Greater Undead

Harvesting souls beyond the current capacity of your soulshield overcharges it granting increased <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistances</LSTag> to all physical damage for a short time. It will also result in an <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_HARVESTED_SOUL_MAX">Empowered Soulshield</LSTag> granting additional effects to your spirit invocations.
Hide Shroud

Ignite your weapon with the Undying Emperor's dark fire for a short time, dealing an additional [1]. Your imbued weapon cannot be disarmed by enemies. Flails, maces, scimitars, and sickles wielded offhand are also ignited.
Improved Shield of Souls

In return for its service after death, this <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_ImmuneToControlUndead">Greater Undead</LSTag> has access to Pact Magic from the necromancer's patron, allowing it to cast spells. It has two Level 2 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> which recharges after every <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
Infernal Skeletal Hound and a Good Boy
Inflict Curse
Invoke Spirit: Apparition
Invoke Spirit: Haunt
Invoke Spirit: Phantasm
Invoke Spirit: Poltergeist
Invoke Spirit: Spook
Invoker of Spirits: Greater Soul Harvest
Invoker of Spirits: Improved Soul Harvest
Invoker of Spirits: Soul Harvest
Leap into enemies. Your sheer size knocks creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Life Drained
Minion Points
Minion Points (Counter)
Monolith of Terror
Murder of Crows
Necrotic Armaments
Necrotic Armaments (Savage Attacker)
Necrotic Energies
Necrotic Fists
Necrotic powers fills this creature with unholy vigor, bestowing upon them resistances to physical weapon and necrotic damage.
Necrotic Shillelagh
Night of the Living Dead
Pact of Eternal Life

Perform a ritual to bind the soul of a slain being to your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Soulshield">Shield of Souls</LSTag>. Each <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_HARVESTED_SOUL">Captured Soul</LSTag> adds +[1] to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmorClass">Armor Class</LSTag> until <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Profane Blessing
Profane Blessing: Corrupted Armor
Profane Blessing: Corrupted Armor
Profane Blessing: Corrupted Grimoire
Profane Intervention
Profane Intervention: Aspect of the Dread Overlord
Profane Possession
Read the Libor Mortis by activating its tooltip.
Reap the Dead
Reap the Dying
Recharging
Reclaim Undead

Release a spirit from your soulshield to distract your enemies, allowing you to retreat to safety without spending any action or bonus action. This consumes the Captured Soul.

Empowered Soulshield: Your movement is doubled.

Release spirits from your soulshield to distract your enemies, allowing you to retreat to safety without spending any action or bonus action. Nearby enemies can be Frightened if they fail a Charisma Saving Throw. This consumes the Captured Souls.

Empowered Soulshield: Affected enemies are slowed and your movement is doubled.

Release troublesome spirits from your soulshield to harass your enemies, moving objects and shoving creatures [1] away from you. Their mischief dazes enemies on a failed Charisma Saving Throw. This consumes the Captured Souls.

Empowered Soulshield: The poltergeists lash out in anger, dealing [2] or half that if targets succeed on their Charisma Saving Throw.

Release troublesome spirits from your soulshield to harass your enemies, moving objects and shoving creatures [1] away from you. Their mischief knocks enemies Prone on a failed Charisma Saving Throw. This consumes the Captured Souls.

Empowered Soulshield: The poltergeists lash out in anger, dealing [2] or half that if targets succeed on their Charisma Saving Throw.
Retract the dark tendrils emanating from your vampiric shroud.
Screaming Spirit
Screaming Spirits
Screaming Spirits

Sever the link to the undead created by the curse <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="NIGHTOFTHELIVINGDEAD">Night of the Living Dead</LSTag>. Regain a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_MINIONPOINTS">Minion Point</LSTag> per each reclaimed undead.
Shadow Beast
Shield of Souls
Shield of Souls
Shroud de Aeternus Vitae
Skeletal Giant
Skeletal Warlock
Slam the massive weapon into enemies with unbridled force, creating a small shockwave centered on the target and knocking all creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.

Some consider the raising of the Greater Undead as sacrilege. None can question the pure devastation a giant or a powerful warlock can cause while alive, but worse still when coupled with the unholy powers of necromancy. Warlocks who have failed to achieve lichdom or prevent their deaths have entered their names into the Libor Mortis in hopes that their damned souls will be returned into material plane in a semblance of unlife by a worthy necromancer. Only an evil warlock would willingly allow themselves to be raised in such a way. Luckily, the power necessary to raise such undead is within the means of only a few...

-- Excerpt from the Libor Mortis

...What follows are scribbles of incantations and pleas to ancient and long-forgotten gods of death and necromancy deities from planes and worlds from beyond Toril. Their names don't ring familiar to you - Vrall, Savoy, Enigma, Thy - but you sense unholy power behind them in the incantations.
Soul Magnet
Soul Magnet: Harvest Souls

Souls of recently slain creatures cry in torment as they disappear into a soulshield.

Each captured soul provides +[1] to Armor Class until Long Rest. The soulshield may hold at the maximum up to [2] additional souls.

You have captured souls equal to the turns remaining.
Souls of the Dead
Souls of the dead scream in anguish around this creature before succumbing to its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Soulshield">soulshield</LSTag>.

Suffuse your necrotic attacks with a curse capable of binding the living to an unlife of service upon dying.

Toggle on to allow your cantrips, spells, and weapon attacks to apply Night of the Living Dead. Limited by your current Minion Points.

Summon a familiar with the form of an infernal skeletal hound with a <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="BrutalBite">brutal bite</LSTag> and a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Terrifying_Howl">terrifying howl</LSTag>. Warning: may sometimes eat crayons!

Summon lost souls from the grave and form them into a protective shield around you. Binding additional souls to your soulshield confer increased protection and unlocks the ability to invoke the spirits to do your bidding, whether for good or for malintent.
Summoner of the Damned
Summoner of the Damned: Create Undead
Summoner of the Damned: Skeletal Giant
Summoner of the Damned: Skeletal Warlock
The air around you grows chill and suddenly you feel your patron's presence. Your mind darkens as the world melts away save for a grotesque tome revealing its profane knowledge to you...
The air around you grows chill and suddenly you feel your patron's presence. Your mind darkens as the world melts away save for a grotesque tome revealing its profane knowledge to you...
The air around you grows chill and suddenly you feel your patron's presence. Your mind darkens as the world melts away save for a grotesque tome revealing its profane knowledge to you...
The air around you grows chill and suddenly you feel your patron's presence. Your mind darkens as the world melts away save for a grotesque tome revealing its profane knowledge to you...

The aspect can Consume Souls of your foes in a large area and damages itself each turn until it is spent. The aspect's attacks curse your enemies with Night of the Living Dead, binding them into service as one of the undead upon dying.

While the aspect persists, its presence provides a Dread Ward that protects you and your allies while imposing an oppressive Aura of Despair against your enemies.

The dark energies from this creature's <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_NecroticBlade">Necrotic Armaments</LSTag> fills them with <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_UnholyVigor">Unholy Vigor</LSTag>. They are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to[1].
The dark fire from your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_NecroticBlade">Necrotic Armaments</LSTag> adds its damage to your unarmed attacks.

Die dunklen Ranken, die von deinem <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_ShroudDeAeternusVitae">Shroud de Aeternus Vitae</LSTag> ausgehen, sind auf das Leben um dich herum eingestimmt. Du kannst diese dunkle Empathie aktivieren, um die Reichweite des vampirischen Leichentuchs zu erhöhen und die Hälfte der Lebenskraft, die es abzieht, mit Verbündeten in der Nähe zu teilen. Wenn der Effekt endet, dauert es einige Zeit, bis sich dein Leichentuch erholt.

The dracolich's oppressive aura gives the affected entity <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> while within [1] of the aspect.
The Dread Overlord

The Necromancy of Thay has taught you how to transform your body into a ravenous <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_SOULMAGNET">Vortex of Souls</LSTag> to ensnare spirits of enemies recently killed in battle, binding them to your soulshield at the end of each combat round.

The Skeletal Warlock can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ChillTouch">Chill Touch</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_RayOfSickness_2">Ray of Sickness</LSTag> at will. It can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_RayOfEnfeeblement">Ray of Enfeeblement</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_ScorchingRay">Scorching Ray</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Sleep_2">Sleep</LSTag> as 2nd-level spells using its two Level 2 spell slots. It can afflict enemies with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="NIGHTOFTHELIVINGDEAD">Night of the Living Dead</LSTag> with its necrotic attacks. It gains the ability to cast the spells <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Slow">Slow</LSTag> at class level 8 and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DeathWard">Death Ward</LSTag> at class level 11 once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
The soul of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_DreadOverlord_Animate_SkeletalMage">powerful warlock</LSTag> has been bound to this corpse to serve a dark design.

The souls of dead form a formidable shield of protection as they spiral around this creature wailing in agony.

Has +[1] to Armor Class until Long Rest.
The very air writhes in dread at the dracolich's malevolent presence. The putrid stench of death and decay surrounds him like a malignant shroud.

This <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_ImmuneToControlUndead">Greater Undead</LSTag> strikes with phenomenal power! It knocks nearby creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> every time it lands a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> or a killing blow.
This corpse has been defiled by a foul ritual.
This creature is being drained by a nearby <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_ShroudDeAeternusVitae">vampiric aura</LSTag>, receiving [1] per turn.

This creature swells with Unholy Vigor.

It is Immune to[1] and all of its attacks deal additional [2].
This creature's soul is in danger of being ensared by a nearby <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_SOULMAGNET">Vortex of Souls</LSTag> upon dying.
This massive weapon is taller than a humanoid. Rust covers the metallic surface, speaking to its age.
This necromancer's weapon attacks burn with dark fire, dealing extra[1].

This powerful <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Undead">undead</LSTag> is <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> from the effects of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ControlUndead">Control Undead</LSTag> and has <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="TurnResistance">Turn Undead</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="MagicResistance">Magic</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistances</LSTag>.
This undead's attacks blaze with dark fire, dealing extra[1].
This weapon blazes with your dracolich patron's fire, dealing extra[1].
Toggle off to silence the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_SOULSHIELD_EFFECT">Screaming Spirits</LSTag>.
Unholy Vigor
Unholy Vigor
Unholy Vigor
Unholy Vigor: Resistance to Necrotic Damage

Unleash a wave of death and rip the souls from these puny mortals! Afflicts enemies with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="NIGHTOFTHELIVINGDEAD">Night of the Living Dead</LSTag>, a curse that binds them to service as one of the undead upon dying.
Vampiric Shroud
Vortex of Souls
When making a melee weapon attack, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.
Whispers from legions of the dead and undead emanate from the object, barely audible yet as loud and raucous as thunder in your mind, beseeching your patron in his many names.

Whispers, barely audible at first, darken your mind becoming louder and more insistent. You feel the presence of your patron as the world dissolves around you save for a leather-bound book. A chill overtakes you as your eyes flit across the words on the cover - Libor Mortis. Its pages open revealing its secrets to you...

Wield a vampiric shroud that absorbs the vitality of nearby living enemies. Its dark tendrils inflict [1] to enemies and heal you for [2] per turn. The shroud persists until your next <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Affected enemies caught inside the shroud continually <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">bleed</LSTag>.

Will [2] ghostly phantasms from your soulshield to strike your foes, each dealing [1] on a hit. This consumes the Captured Souls.

Empowered Soulshield: Doubles the damage of each Phantasm.

Will a ghostly phantasm from your soulshield to strike a target of your choosing, dealing [1] on a hit. This consumes the Captured Soul.

Empowered Soulshield: Doubles the damage of each Phantasm.
Wrath of the Undead

Wrench the very souls from the mortal husks of your weakened enemies and bind them to your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Soulshield">Shield of Souls</LSTag>. Executes enemies with less than 20% health. Each <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DREADOVERLORD_HARVESTED_SOUL">Captured Soul</LSTag> adds +[1] to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmorClass">Armor Class</LSTag> until <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

You are Resistant to[1].

Imbuing your weapon with Necrotic Armaments fills you Unholy Vigor, making you Immune to[1] for a short time.
You are surrounded by a swirling vortex of lost and phantom spirits screaming in terror as you bind them to your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_Soulshield">soulshield</LSTag>.
You have full control of the soulshield when wearing any armor in any slots while wearing Reaper's Embrace.
You invoke his name - Dread Overlord - and suddenly you feel his presence. Your mind darkens as the world melts away save for a grotesque tome opening its pages to you...

You know the spell Animate Dead which you may cast at-will. You also gain the power to create Greater Undead such as a Skeletal Warlock without expending a Warlock Spell Slot once per Long Rest.

You may summon each type of Greater Undead in addition to a minor undead from the spell Animate Dead.

An excerpt regarding this necromantic power reveals itself in the Libor Mortis

You know the spell <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CreateUndead">Create Undead</LSTag>, allowing you to raise a fearsome mummy at-will. This does not count towards spells gained from the Mystic Arcanum feature.

You may command a spirit from your soulshield to come to the aid of an ally as a reaction, adding +2 to their Armor Class for 3 turns. This consumes the Captured Soul.

Empowered Soulshield: Reduces all incoming damage by 1.

You may command spirits from your soulshield to come to the aid of an ally as a reaction, adding +[1] to their Armor Class for 3 turns. This consumes the Captured Souls.

Empowered Soulshield: Reduces all incoming damage by [2].

You may harvest souls of the dead and bind them in a greater soulshield for protection or invoke the spirits' wrath against your enemies. You can command the souls of the dead to surround you in a protective Shield of Souls, initially adding +[1] to your Armor Class until Long Rest.

You may bind additional spirits to your soulshield from corpses with Commit Corpse or Reap the Dead, or rip the souls of nearly dead enemies with Reap the Dying. Each Captured Soul provides an additional +[2] to Armor Class.

Invoke the spirits with greater Spook, Apparition, Phantasm, Haunt, and Poltergeist.

Harvesting souls beyond the current capacity of your soulshield overcharges it granting increased Resistances to all physical damage for a short time. It will also result in an Empowered Soulshield granting additional effects to your spirit invocations.

An excerpt regarding this necromantic power reveals itself in the Libor Mortis.

You may harvest souls of the dead and bind them in a soulshield for protection or invoke the spirits' wrath against your enemies. You can command the souls of the dead to surround you in a protective Shield of Souls, initially adding +[1] to your Armor Class until Long Rest.

You may bind additional spirits to your soulshield with Commit Corpse. Each Captured Soul provides an additional +[2] to Armor Class.

You may command the captured soul to do your bidding in combat. As long as you have a Captured Soul available, you may invoke the spirit to Spook your enemies, protect an ally through a ghostly Apparition, or will the vengeful Phantasm to strike your enemies.

Harvesting souls beyond the current capacity of your soulshield overcharges it granting increased Resistances to all physical damage for a short time. It will also result in an Empowered Soulshield granting additional effects to your spirit invocations.

An excerpt regarding this necromantic power reveals itself in the Libor Mortis.

You may harvest souls of the dead and bind them in an improved soulshield for protection or invoke the spirits' wrath against your enemies. You can command the souls of the dead to surround you in a protective Shield of Souls, initially adding +[1] to your Armor Class until Long Rest.

You may bind additional spirits to your soulshield from corpses with Commit Corpse or Reap the Dead. Each Captured Soul provides an additional +[2] to Armor Class.

Your command of the souls of the dead has grown in power: you may invoke the spirits with improved versions of Spook, Apparition, and Phantasm. You may also invoke the spirits to Haunt an enemy or enlist a Poltergeist to push enemies away.

Harvesting souls beyond the current capacity of your soulshield overcharges it granting increased Resistances to all physical damage for a short time. It will also result in an Empowered Soulshield granting additional effects to your spirit invocations.

An excerpt regarding this necromantic power reveals itself in the Libor Mortis.
You may raise undead from the curse <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="NIGHTOFTHELIVINGDEAD">Night of the Living Dead</LSTag> equal to the remaining duration.

You're a cultist fighting under the banner of the Dread Overlord, a monstrous dracolich necromancer who seeks to spread His maleficence and terror over all lands. In return for your service, boundless power over death itself and the promise of eternal life await. Command the very souls of the dead and raise powerful Greater Undead in His profane name!
Your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_UnholyVigor">Unholy Vigor</LSTag> makes you <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immune</LSTag> to[1].
Your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="DreadOverlord_UnholyVigor">Unholy Vigor</LSTag> makes you <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to Necrotic damage.

Your ability to inflict Night of the Living Dead is limited by your current Minion Points.

Replenished by Short or Long Rest.

Dein Pakt mit dem Schreckensherrscher hat dich mit profanem Wissen verflucht. Addiere +1 zu jedem Wurf, der entweder mit Arcana oder History erstellt wurde. Die grausame Überlieferung hat dir beigebracht, wie du Feinde, die durch nekrotischen Schaden durch deine Cantrips, Zaubersprüche und Waffenangriffe geschädigt wurden, mit Nacht der lebenden Toten verfluchen und sie zum Untod verurteilen kannst . Außerdem kannst du auf magische Weise auf den Libor Mortis zugreifen, um seine unheiligen Seiten zu sehen.
Euer Schutzherr ist der Schreckensherrscher, ein monströser drakolischer Nekromant, der seine Boshaftigkeit und seinen Schrecken über alle Länder verbreiten will.

Your power to command the Greater Undead grows. You can now raise a terrifying Skeletal Giant without expending a Warlock Spell Slot once per Long Rest.

You may summon each type of Greater Undead in addition to a minor undead from the spell Animate Dead.

An excerpt regarding this necromantic power reveals itself in the Libor Mortis
Your recent attempts to empathize with your allies has left you drained. Your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DreadOverlord_ShroudDeAeternusVitae">vampiric shroud</LSTag> is currently recharging.
